text: Alfonso Cuaron Orozco received an Academy Award in the best director category for his much - hyped film “ Roma ” despite its lacking both the nostalgic humor necessary to a family drama as well as the sort of innocent naivete in a remembrance of childhood . His visual strategy of piling on ponderous images overwhelms the audiences , thereby keeping viewers in a gullible stupor , if for no other reason to divert attention away from its whitewash of mass murder of hundreds , and more IN thousands , of idealistic students . The financing for this con job came from Participant NNP , which churns out NNP - friendly propaganda IN “ Syriana ” , “ Darfur ” and that paranoiac NN report from Agency patron NNP Gore . Flashback to 911 , on a flight over Chicago , and the lanky passenger sitting next to me introduces himself as an editor with a JJ streaming - NN NN called Netflix , who urges me as a writer of intelligence - related articles to send my resume to “ the Canadian guy who makes the decisions and fronts the NN for productions , ” citing a name . I asked : “ Is he Jewish ? ” Nod . “ So what ’s the point when he ’s VBG to rip me off ? ” My Yid pals on Flatbush and Fairfax are surely laughing at that zinger . The avoidance strategy had to eventually fail , as it just did , now with the Yid-pic “ Roma ” , which was financed by Participant CEO Jeffrey Skoll , the VBN Canadian who serves as CD of the Hollywood cut-outs for the Office of NNP Affairs ( OPA , which sounds a lot IN opioid for the masses ) , the Agency ’s bureau for JJ NN - NN and propaganda . Excuse me once again , this NN for the CD - track approach deployed below , a critical - NN cinema review of a Jewish melodrama in Mexico alongside a counter - intelligence analysis of Yanqui spies high on tequila and cocaina . From my archaic slang it can be surmised that I ’m a survivor of those halcyon NNS and often went south of the Border for mezcal shots while waiting for a craftsman to complete a 12 - string guitar in the silent NN between the balas , which is Spanish for “ bullets ” . As the motive force that paid the death squads that conducted the sort of massacres depicted in “ Roma ” , the NNP has a keen interest in toning down or editing out critical parts of the modern history of Mexico City , an important chapter in clandestine operations and in fact CD of its finest achievements . The intel offices inside the US Embassy within the DF ( Distrito Federal , the capital ) served as an offshore ops center against Castro Cuba with its JJ inroads into Gulf + Western ’s Dominican Republic and NNP Fruits ’ Central NNP . The Agency ’s more venal interest in Mexico derived from the steady unreported income for off - the - books blacks ops and payoffs thanks to the generosity of its business partners out of Sinaloa , Michoacan and Juarez . ( A substantial part of that Yanqui cut , of course , gets cycled and cleansed through Hollywood , Vegas and the Democratic Party of California . ) Therefore , let ’s explore how “ Roma ” whitewashes the NNP crimes in 1960s - 70s Mexico before delving into its other more grotesque themes . Cuaron chose to focus on the Corpus Christi day massacre of 1971 rather the more revealing Tlatelolco Plaza nighttime massacre in October 1968 . At the NN , the JJ ambassador Fulton Freeman was a high - ranking member of the Department of NNP ’s diplomatic intelligence service ( he went on to serve as NN of the Monterey Institute ) and had a previous posting in Paris . Just days after the French student protests toppled the de Gaulle NN , as youth revolts and anti-Vietnam NN movements were mushrooming across the USA and worldwide . Later in early autumn antiwar protests at the Chicago Democratic National Convention shattered JJ confidence in the NN effort , effectively tolling the bell for the LBJ NN policy . Panic was gripping Langley and Foggy Bottom with the realization that NNP was not just facing defeat in Vietnam but RB was about to lose everything else . Envoy Freemen called an emergency meeting of his intelligence staff to quell the swelling protest marches pouring out of universities throughout Mexico . Paranoia strikes deep and into PRP ’s heart it will creep . The NNP station chief Winston “ Scottie ” Scott did not buy into the End of Empire scenario and enjoyed nothing better than a NN - and - death NN with the clear understanding that it was the opposition that must do the dying , RB though they MD be just college kids with naive ideas about a better NN . In preparing for just such a scuffle , Scottie had bribed NNP Gustavo Diaz Ordaz , and his family for good measure , and JJ - hand fixer Luis Echeverria , and the capital cops for good measure , since Yanqui dinero went a JJ ways then , especially for Operation TEMPO , the buying of the Institutional Revolutionary Party ( PRI ) . However much their hundreds of field agents and thousands of paid informers tired , the vast spy network MD not come up with a single instance of Cuban or garden - variety communist subversion inciting the students , who were fiercely focused on realizing a democracy since capitalism was n’t much of a menace to the lower classes in a Mexican economy dominated by NN - own monopolities . Without a smoking gun , the NNP did the next best thing , which was to JJ flags by organizing JJ terror cells , of criminals posing as students armed with AKs from NNP with serial numbers filed off and recruiting a Trotskyite splinter group to plant dud explosives on NN transformers in the city center . Alfonso Cuaron VBD his student protest scenes on notes , photos and newsclippings left by his late uncle , a Trotskyite in the phony bomb plot . IN uncle IN nephew , it ’s the same game of duplicity , eh , ninos ? Truthfulness is not CD of Cuaron ’s assets . Trotsky in Mexico has cultic status . After his escape from the purge in Stalin ’s Moscow , Leon Trotsky fled to Mexico , where he was lionized by the Jewish artist Diego Rivera , who was patronized by John D. Rockefeller for the famous Ford Motor mural in Detroit . Just prior to the Russian Revolution , the Ukrainian Jew Trotsky had VBN favor on a tour of the NNP NNPS with the German - Jewish banker Jacob Schiff with the Loeb , Kuhn and partners , the financial firm underwritten by the NN of Rothschild in Frankfurt , Germany . He got a blank check to take NNP out of NNP NNP I , to save the Rothschild homeland . The founder of the Red Army ended up dying ingloriously with an icepick in his temple inserted by a Comintern agent , so his followers wanted revenge at any NN on the left however they MD VB it , and thus the JJ flag operation involving an attempted city blackout . Trotskyism certainly was not in the mainstream of the uber - wealthy Jewish financiers and merchants in the Polanco District or in Cuaron ’s boyhood neighborhood of Colonia Roma , comprising middle - class Sephardic Jews from Aleppo and Damascus , Syria , most of them professionals , including engineers , teachers and physicians as seen in the film . What I ’ve just written , the comedy of a misguided Jewish radical caught up in a NNP entrapment scheme that shames his conservative immigrant family , should have been the narrative of a retrospective film on Mexico in its moment of NN amid a massive JJ - JJ transition . Instead , audiences have been presented with an over - aestheticized simulacrum that pretends to be a childhood autobiography but then morphs into neo - fascist visual orgy with backhanded praise for NN - sponsored repression . Since there has been so much adulation for the Cuaron “ masterpiece ” , let me VB hats from helmet to a physician ’s cap to start dissecting this monstrosity . But RB , this . So what transpired in the plaza that on the night of October 2 , 1968 ? Thousands of students from Polytechnic NNP poured onto the streets to march for democracy . Meanwhile NNP - directed JJ snipers dress in plainclothes were positioned on the roof and doorways of the Chihuahua building overlooking Tlateloloco Plaza with orders to shoot anyone trying to escape the square , which was surrounded by riot NN . Once the plaza was filled , the hail of lead was so intense that 16 NN officers sustained gunshot wounds , their injuries blamed on students . An accurate death count was never conducted since most were dragged off to mass graves , with latter - day estimates in the hundreds . At the NN , the Spanish radio stations and underground press estimated 2,300 unarmed protesters were killed . Nowadays , we hear a lot from the US NN about Tiananmen Square , but what happened in Mexico City was far worse yet has been met with stony silence from the mainstream NN . The Mexico City Olympics proceeded on schedule later that month , but was interrupted at an awards ceremony when CD JJ sprinters defiantly raised their fists in protest at NN - sponsored mass murder IN the NN , including inside the NNP NNPS against their brethen . And now , four decades after , Alfonso Cuaron feels honored to receive the NN - soaked dollars from these murderers . Mexican Mothers NN Abortion The ostensible aim in “ Roma ” is to spotlight courageous women in a family NN , yet a more disturbing agenda emerges with a sinister assault on the birth rate among the nation ’s impoverished masses . The heroism on display arises not from the protagonist , a pregnant housekeeper named Cleo , nor RB the soft - spoken grandmother Teresa , the matriarch who rises to the challenge of wading through gunfire to escort the maid in the throes of contractions to a maternity ward . No , it is the bombshell revelation amid an earthquake . The consequence of these praiseworthy and charming women ’s ordeals is not some deserved reward that compensates NN ’s slings and arrows , but to the contrary the politically correct conclusion that losing an infant is better than adding another mouth to feed for Mexico . Moving on , the story then takes a turn toward darkness , when the unsung male heroes of “ Roma ” are shown to be those fearless young men in the death squads holding the lid down on per capita consumption and ensuring population reduction by any means . text: In the waning days of CD , liberal late - night hosts took to meeting with their counterparts in the conservative entertainment complex . “ The Daily Show ’s ” Trevor Noah argued with The Blaze ’s Tomi Lahren about the nature of race in NNP ; “ Full Frontal ’s ” Samantha Bee interviewed JJ - wing radio host Glenn Beck for a summit on “ nonpartisan decency . ” The NN of these segments , supposedly , was the reconciliation of unlikely opposites . But how opposite have these CD groups RB been ? The post - truth condition , in which Trumpism has flourished , has its roots in left - wing satire . CD was the NN when the line between parody and reality blurred to the point of vanishing . JJ NN spread through JJ NN as swiftly as it did thoroughly . By the end of October , a PPP poll VBD that 40 percent of Donald NNP supporters in Florida thought Hillary NNP was “ an actual demon ” — who MD make up anything crazier than that ? Post - fact NN is funny but not ha- ha funny . Everything has become a joke and so nothing is anymore . But satire swallowed the NN RB . The point of origin was probably Jon Stewart ’s legendary appearance on “ Crossfire ” in 2004 , in which he claimed that the high - volume JJ debate program was existentially evil rather than in error : “ It ’s not so much that it ’s bad , as it ’s hurting NNP . ” When the hosts brought up Stewart ’s softball questioning of JJ figures , he VBD satire as an alibi . “ My point is this , ” Stewart VBD . “ If your idea of confronting me is that I do n’t ask hard - hitting enough NN questions , we ’re in bad shape , fellows . ” Stewart put himself in an ideal position — he was moral arbiter who MD determine what was hurting NNP while he took no responsibility himself . He knew better than journalists but he was not subject to their rules . He was just an entertainer . But he was n’t . While “ Crossfire ” soon died , “ The Daily Show ” went on to become as regular a source for NN as USA Today . In 2009 , a NNP magazine poll declared Stewart the most trusted NN anchor on the air . “ The Daily Show , ” and those who emerged from it , indulged a contempt for real NN institutions while effectively competing with them . In 2010 , Stewart led the Rally to Restore Sanity in NNP — an overtly JJ act . The comedy - politics confusion is n’t unique to the NNP NNPS . Beppe Grillo began as a JJ satirist and now leads the Five Star Movement in Italy . In 2013 , the Five Star Movement , which sits with the NNP Kingdom Independence Party in the Europe of Freedom and Direct Democracy group in the European Parliament , was the second most popular party in the Italian Chamber of Deputies . Real NN brings with it the problems satirists love to mock , though : In December , the Five Star Movement had to disown Virginia Raggi , the mayor of Rome , when CD of her advisors was arrested for alleged corruption . In CD sense , of course , JJ satire is the opposite of JJ NN . Satirists rip away the pretenses of journalism to reveal what they VBP to be JJ . JJ NN sites use the pretenses of journalism to spread what they VBP to be JJ . Despite intentions , however , the effect is the same . JJ satirists , and their audiences , have turned the NN itself into a joke . No matter what the NN of their politics , they have contributed to the post - factual NN of JJ JJ discourse . It does n’t matter what Sam Bee or John Oliver VBP ; it matters that their comedy is the source for JJ NN . Satire , IN JJ NN , creates a sense of community through rejection . It delights in tearing down institutions but is useless at constructing them . Jonathan Swift VBD that satire was a mirror in which viewers discovered everybody ’s face but their own ; its pleasure is the pleasure of othering . The act is inherently tribal as well as JJ , and JJ NN exacerbates the tribalism . Left - wing friends eagerly post John Oliver ’s latest screed with THIS in all caps , hoping for mutual virtue - signaling . JJ - wing friends post pizzagate fantasies to prove how deep their anger runs . The actual NN is more or less irrelevant — at least beyond which side is the object of derision . In a recent survey by Pew Research , 14 percent of respondents admitted that they intentionally shared JJ NN . The left and the NN in NNP are in a contest of competitive virality : comic bits vs. JJ NN . In CD , the NN of outraged mockery was vastly greater than the NN of informed debate . But the immediate NN of JJ JJ satire in the NNP era is more basic . It ’s simple , RB : NNP benefits from being satirized . The greatest modern expression of JJ satire , Spy magazine , mocked NNP for its entire run . ( Spy teased NNP for having JJ hands RB before Marco Rubio did . ) Their contempt only aided his manic self - promotion . The same is unquestionably JJ for the current NNP parodies on “ Saturday Night Live . ” In the NNP NNP Times , Alec Baldwin acknowledged that his performances of NNP run the NN of humanizing him . If only that were nothing more than a NN . Parodying NNP is at best a distraction from his real politics ; at worst it converts the whole of politics into a gag . The process has nothing to do with the performers or the writers or their choices . NNP built his candidacy on performing as a comic heel — that has been his pop culture persona for decades . It is simply not possible to parody effectively a NN who is a conscious self - parody , and who has become NN of the NNP NNPS on the basis of that performance . Where does this NN of affairs put comedians now ? On CD side are the engaged comics , IN Bee and Oliver , who are becoming increasingly indistinguishable from straight JJ commentators , shouting their arguments with an occasional comic aside . Ironically , they look and feel increasingly IN a liberal version of “ Crossfire . ” On the other side are the comedians of retreat , Jimmy Fallon chuckling over lip- syncing celebrities and carpool karaoke with James Corden . NNP wins either NN . He wins if he ’s a punch line and he wins if he ’s ignored . That ’s what you VBP when you elect a walking , talking joke . Stephen Marche is a novelist and columnist . He wrote this for the Los Angeles Times .

text: Prior JJ beliefs and the tendency for conspiracist ideation appear particularly important for individuals ' endorsement of FN , regardless of prior exposure to the specific NN presented . As such , NN NN ( CT ) belief and its underlying mechanisms appear a useful starting point in identifying some of the underlying individual difference variables involved in conspiratorial and non‐conspiratorial FN belief . Implications and limitations are discussed . JJ viewpoint was a consistent predictor of FN endorsement . Conspiratorial worldview and schizotypal personality RB predicted FN belief , with weaker or less consistent prediction by other variables including dangerous worldview , normlessness , and randomness beliefs . Partial correlation analysis suggested that most variables related to FN through their association with conspiracist ideation and JJ identity beliefs . Politically ‐slanted JJ NN ( FN ) — manufactured disinformation , hoaxes , and satire appearing to present JJ NN about events — is currently receiving extensive attention in the mainstream NN . However , it is currently unclear what factors MD influence an individual 's likelihood to VB in FN , outside of JJ identity . As FN is often conspiratorial in nature and usually negative , it was theorised that conspiracist belief , and factors that have been VBN to relate to a conspiratorial worldview ( i.e. , dangerous worldview and schizotypy ) , MD RB relate to JJ FN . The phenomenon of “ JJ NN ” in the CD U.S. presidential NN campaign received widespread attention in the mainstream NN . Some commentators RB suggested — in the immediate aftermath of the result — that it had influenced the outcome of the NN itself ( Parkinson , CD ; Read , CD ) . JJ NN ( FN ) refers to manufactured disinformation , hoaxes , and satire appearing to present JJ NN about events , which are spread primarily via JJ NN ( Allcott & Gentzkow , 2017 ; Macquarie Dictionary RB , n.d. ) . Relationships between FN and behaviour are yet to be reported scientifically , but there is concern about the influence of FN — particularly politically ‐relevant FN — and what can be done to counter it ( VB Allcott & Gentzkow , 2017 ; Hunt , CD ; Wendling , 2017 ) . Politically slanted FN NN is usually negative , with numerous stories damaging to Donald NNP and Hillary NNP circulating RB prior to the CD NN ( VB www.snopes.com, for examples ) . The NN of FN often has a conspiratorial aspect : the belief that the explanation for events ( or their concealment ) is that powerful forces are secretly at work to realise their sinister plans ( cf. Swami , Chamorro ‐ Premuzic , & Furnham , 2010 ; Zonis & Joseph , 1994 ) . For example , in the week before the NN a story dubbed “ Pizzagate , ” began to circulate , since assessed as being JJ ( La Capria , CD ) . It alleged that hacked emails from JJ NNP presidential campaign manager , John Podesta , revealed a NN whereby a secret paedophile ring was operating out of a NN NN in the NNP DC that had hosted NNP ‐related events ( La Capria , CD ) . Given the similarity of much FN to conspiracist ideation , and the larger existing literature on why NNS VBP in NN NNS ( CTs ) , in this NN we wished to examine whether CT belief , and factors linked in recent studies to CT belief , were a factor underlying FN belief , particularly FN with a conspiratorial bent . In the literature on the psychology of CTs , a popular notion is the idea of conspiracist ideation or a conspiracist mentality : NNS who VBP in CD CT tend to VB in more than CD ( Moscovici , 1987 ; Swami FW al. , 2011 ) . Goertzel ( 1994 ) noted that more than 80 % of respondents in his NN believed that at least CD or more CTs from a list of CD were definitely or probably JJ . He attributed this tendency to a “ monological belief NN ” ( p. 740 ) , wherein belief in CD CT becomes a source of NN for other CTs , enhancing the likelihood of belief in JJ CTs ( VB RB Imhoff & Bruder , 2013 ; Moulding FW al. , CD ; Swami FW al. , 2010 , 2011 ; Wood , Douglas , & Sutton , 2012 ) . Further , Swami FW al. ( 2011 ) VBD , in an Austrian sample ( N = 281 ) , that belief in CTs was RB predictive of belief in fictional CTs created by the research team . While a range of variables have been VBN to be implicated in conspiracist belief , perhaps the most consistent findings involve the conceptually related factors comprising a “ dangerous worldview ” ( e.g. , Abalakina ‐Paap , Stephan , Craig , & Gregory , 1999 ) . These factors include low levels of trust and greater powerlessness , JJ isolation , and alienation / anomie ( Abalakina ‐ Paap FW al. , 1999 ; Goertzel , 1994 ; Moulding FW al. , CD ) . Moulding FW al. ( CD ) describe the relationship of CT belief with dangerous worldview ‐related factors as the “ coping‐with‐alienation‐and‐powerlessness ” ( p. 346 ) explanation of CT belief . Consistent with this characterisation , and as observed by Abalakina ‐Paap FW al. ( 1999 ) , such NNS reject both official and conventional explanations for what is VBG on in the NN . Instead , CTs provide an alternative explanation of both salient events and ultimately the individual 's own circumstances : the NN is a bad place , full of bad NNS plotting for personal gain ( Moulding FW al. , CD ) . Belief in conspiratorial FN MD work in a similar NN , wherein the individual 's relative disenfranchisement and disadvantage can be explained in their own NN by the belief that powerful elites are actively cooperating in , or choosing to ignore , malevolent wrong ‐doing . Therefore , it is plausible that dangerous worldview ‐related factors are associated not only with belief in CTs , but RB with belief in conspiratorial FN . Recent research has RB noted that schizotypal personality traits are a robust predictor of CT belief — consisting of odd and unusual beliefs , suspicion , magical thinking , perceptual distortions , and paranoia ( Barron , Morgan , Towell , Altemeyer , & Swami , 2014 ; Barron FW al. , 2018 ; Bruder , Haffke , Neave , Nouripanah , & Imhoff , 2013 ; Darwin , Neave , & Holmes , 2011 ; Swami FW al. , 2013 ) . For example , Barron FW al. ( 2014 ) VBD that schizotypal beliefs , and particularly the odd beliefs and magical thinking subscale , were strong predictors of CT beliefs in a JJ questionnaire NN . Darwin FW al. ( 2011 ) suggested it was particularly the tendency to suspicion that linked schizotypy and CT belief . More recently , Barron FW al. ( 2018 ) VBD VBG questionnaires that a decrease in analytic thinking partially mediated between the link between schizotypal NNS and CT belief , among other factors ( cf. Moulding FW al. , CD ) . Regardless of the exact mechanism ( i.e. , reasoning or NN ‐view ) , these studies provide NN to suggest a relationship between schizotypal traits and beliefs in CTs , and by extension to conspiratorial FN . Finally , examining belief in FN in the context of the CD U.S. presidential NN demands some consideration of the role of JJ identity . The CT literature suggests that there is generally no significant difference between left‐wing liberals and right‐wing conservatives as to who is more inclined to a conspiracist mentality ( Edelson , Alduncin , Krewson , Sieja , & Uscinski , 2017 ; Goertzel , 1994 ; Oliver & Wood , 2014 ) . However , belief in specific CTs is differentiated by JJ or socio‐political persuasion ( Oliver & Wood , 2014 ; Uscinski , Klofstad , & Atkinson , CD ) . In short , Republicans are more likely to VB the CT that NNP Obama was not born in the NNP NNPS ( Oliver & Wood , 2014 ) , while Democrats are more likely to VB that NNP Bush was complicit in the September 11 attacks ( Allcott & Gentzkow , 2017 ) . Allcott and Gentzkow ( 2017 ) VBD that Democrats and Republicans are more likely to VB politically congruent FN stories than neutral ones . Building on these findings , it seems likely that Democrats and Republicans are more likely to VB politically congruent — and disbelieve politically incongruent — conspiratorial and non‐conspiratorial FN . The aim of this NN was to test whether CT beliefs , JJ identity , and factors previously shown to be involved in CT belief are RB involved in belief in conspiratorial and non‐conspiratorial FN , VBG a questionnaire design in a sample of U.S. participants . It was predicted that conspiracist ideation MD be positively related to belief in conspiratorial FN , and that JJ identity MD be positively related to belief in FN about the opposite party 's candidate and negatively correlated with belief in conspiratorial FN about PRP 's own candidate . It was hypothesised that schizotypy , dangerous worldview , randomness , and alienation MD be positively related to belief in conspiratorial FN , and that perceived benevolence of the NN MD be negatively related to belief in conspiratorial FN . While there are reasonable theoretical grounds to VB these hypotheses are JJ for conspiratorial FN , hypotheses will RB be tested for relationships with non‐conspiratorial FN . Finally , to VB for whether it is just a factor of exposure to the specific FN via the NN , we RB examined whether entirely fictitious conspiratorial FN invented for this NN had similar correlates . There was no missing NNS . Scales had acceptable reliability , except for the belief in non‐conspiratorial FN about NNP subscale , which was marginal ( α = 0.65 ; VB Table 1 ) . Consistent with the overall voting history , the sample was somewhat left ‐leaning , but there was suitable range for analysis . Correlational analyses suggested that the three JJ variables correlated with the NN types for all candidates , with the PIS significantly correlating with all types of NN , whereas the LRS and LAS correlated with four of the six types , with correlations in the expected directions . Conspiratorial ideation related positively to all types of FN excepting non‐conspiratorial FN regarding NNP , while the OLIFE related to all types excepting FN for NNP and entirely ‐fictitious FN for NNP , the latter of which just missed significance . Of the worldview variables , the DWS and DAS ‐ Norm related positively to four of the six NN types , while the WAS ‐ Randomness related negatively to FN and entirely factiously JJ NN ( EFN ) regarding NNP , and positively to conspiratorial FN regarding NNP . The other variables did not relate to FN endorsement . As we were interested in whether the variables related above ‐and ‐beyond conspiratorial ideation , and above ‐and ‐beyond JJ identity , partial correlations were performed controlling separately for these variables ( Table 2 ) . Only variables that were initially significant for at least some types of FN were considered for analysis . Generally , when controlling for JJ identity , the Left–Right Scale and Libertarian–Authoritarian Scale was reduced in their strength of correlation , though the LAS remained significant for some variables consistent with it measuring a wider construct than the JJ identity scale . Interestingly , the WAS ‐ Randomness only remained significant for CD variable ( FN ‐ NNP ) , and the Dangerous Wordview Scale was RB reduced in JJ of its correlations , while DAS ‐Normlessness , the BCTI and OLIFE were largely unaffected , when controlling for JJ identity . In contrast , controlling for conspiratorial worldview did not affect the general pattern of correlations of FN with JJ variables or WAS ‐Randomness , but did largely reduce correlations with the OLIFE and DAS ‐Normlessness , and the DWS . Correlations for prediction of various FN types The aim of this NN was to test whether factors previously shown to be involved in CT belief are RB involved in belief in conspiratorial and non‐conspiratorial JJ FN . It was hypothesised that conspiracist ideation MD be positively related to belief in conspiratorial FN . This hypothesis was supported . It was hypothesised that schizotypy , dangerous worldview , randomness , and alienation MD be positively related to belief in conspiratorial FN and benevolence MD be negatively related to belief in conspiratorial FN . There was partial support for this hypothesis . The final hypothesis was that JJ identity and JJ views MD be positively related to belief in conspiratorial FN about the opposite party 's candidate and negatively correlated with belief in conspiratorial FN about PRP 's own candidate . Again , this hypothesis was supported . As was anticipated , VBN on research by Allcott and Gentzkow ( 2017 ) , JJ identity was related to belief in conspiratorial FN that is congruent with PRP 's JJ viewpoint . Similarly , more general left–right and libertarian–authoritarian views were related to belief in FN , excepting the CD conspiratorial categories regarding NNP . That these predictive relationships exist is unsurprising , but it is important that this is now established empirically . That JJ identity predicted belief in FN MD be attributable to a phenomenon VBN as motivated reasoning , or motivated partisan reasoning . In motivated reasoning , NNS have been VBN to process NN in a NN that protects or enhances their current belief NN ( RB in the face of contradictory NN ; Miller , Saunders , & Farhart , 2015 ) . Motivated partisan reasoning happens when NNS judge NN about their ingroup more positively and NN about the outgroup more negatively ( Claassen & Ensley , CD ; Edelson FW al. , 2017 ) . There is a significant body of NN to suggest that motivated reasoning elicits differences in how NNS process NN on topics ranging from JJ football to JJ campaigning “ dirty tricks ” ( Carey , Nyhan , Valentino , & Liu , CD ; Claassen & Ensley , CD ) . Indeed , Edelson FW al. ( 2017 ) VBD that conspiratorial thinking and motivated partisan reasoning were both predictors of belief in electoral fraud in the NNP NNPS . Research directly investigating whether JJ identity influences FN through such mechanisms MD be an important branch of future work . Turning to conspiracist ideation , general conspiratorial thinking related to belief in conspiratorial FN ( both for in‐circulation FN and fictious FN invented for this NN ) , and indeed RB predicted non‐conspiracist FN regarding NNP . This MD suggest that Goertzel 's “ monological belief NN ” MD RB be at work in belief in FN regardless of whether such NN stories are novel or in‐circulation ( cf. Moulding FW al. , CD ; Swami FW al. , 2011 ) . VBN on suggestions that conspiratorial worldview MD be related to FN belief , we RB examined factors that have been VBN to predict CT more generally in whether they linked to FN . Consistent with its relationship to the conspiratorial worldview ( e.g. , Darwin FW al. , 2011 ) , we VBD that schizotypy RB positively predicted all types of JJ FN barring non‐conspiratorial FN for NNP . These findings were largely — albeit not completely — removed when controlling for conspiratorial worldview , but not when controlling JJ views . Similar but less strong or less consistent relationships were VBN with dangerous worldview , which were again removed when controlling for conspiracism , and to a lesser extent by JJ identity . Randomness was positively related to belief in conspiratorial FN about NNP , and negatively with belief in FN about NNP and fictitious FN regarding NNP . The relationship between randomness and the FN variables was largely ameliorated when controlling for JJ identity but not conspiracism . This suggests that the relationship between randomness and FN was due to associations with JJ identity rather than conspiracism ; indeed , in contrast to the findings of Moulding FW al. ( CD ) , randomness was not related to conspiracist ideation generally . The opposing findings indicate that NNS who VBP hidden order in society are more likely to endorse NNP conspiratorial FN , whereas those who VBP that societal events are more chaotic are more likely to endorse NNP FN . While benevolence and alienation were related to conspiracist ideation generally , only normlessness predicted FN , with JJ relationships with the FN variables excepting non‐conspiratorial NNP FN , while the relationships with conspiratorial FN regarding NNP just missed significance . These relationships were largely removed when controlling for conspiracism but not JJ identity . Overall , then , we VBD that JJ identity and conspiracism were strong and important predictors of JJ FN , with only the relationship between non‐conspiratorial FN regarding NNP and conspiracist thinking missing significance . It was a little surprising that the non‐conspiratorial FN regarding NNP was predicted by conspiracism ; however , examination of the items indicated that the non‐conspiratorial NNP items RB implied a level of public–private duplicity that MD perhaps be consistent with a conspiratorial viewpoint RB if they are not strictly conspiratorial by definition . Overall , it appears that some of the worldview variables are important factors , but that these MD operate through their association with JJ identity ( in the NN of left–right views , randomness , and to some extent dangerous worldview ) , or with conspiracism ( particularly for schizotypy , normlessness , and to a greater extent , dangerous worldview ) . Generally , significant relationships between the independent variables and conspiratorial and non‐conspiratorial FN about NNP seemed of a stronger effect size than the independent variable relationships with belief in conspiratorial FN about NNP . Indeed , there is a JJ body of NN to suggest that at the present NN , Republicans MD indeed be more likely to VB or have stronger belief in FN than Democrats . Allcott and Gentzkow ( 2017 ) VBD that FN favouring NNP both out ‐numbered and was out ‐shared on NNP compared to FN favouring NNP , by factors of three ‐to‐one and four ‐to‐one respectively ( although they note that sharing a story is not the same as believing it ; indeed , it MD not be the same as RB reading it ) . They speculate that CD possible explanation for this is that Republicans are more inclined to VB FN . Interestingly , they cite NN ( McClosky & Chong , 1985 ; Uscinski FW al. , CD ) of non‐partisanship in a predisposition to conspiratorial thinking as NN against this hypothesis . Pennycook and Rand ( 2017 ) VBD NNP supporters were better able to discern JJ from real NN than were NNP supporters in their recent NN ( N = 800 ) , where participants were asked to judge the accuracy of NN headlines presented in “ NNP ” format . In summary , there are potential between ‐group differences VBN on JJ identity regarding belief in FN that merit further investigation . However , we wish to strongly note that as we did not have any a priori hypotheses regarding these specific differences , such findings should be viewed as post hoc , and should be taken with great caution unless replicated . There were limitations in this NN . Participants were predominantly young and more left‐wing than the average voter , and so generalisation MD be questioned . Reported voting ( 87 % ) was higher than the national average ( estimated by McDonald , CD at RB 60 % ) , suggesting participants were more politically engaged than MD be typical . The NN is correlational in nature and thus causation cannot be inferred . The subscale measuring belief in non‐conspiratorial FN about NNP had only marginal reliability , which MD have lowered NN . We RB did not ask participants if they had been exposed to the specific FN stories , which MD have played a role in the findings ; while the findings with entirely fabricated FN argue against a mere exposure effect , these were lower than for the other categories of FN generally . It MD be useful to gauge this in future studies , although care should be taken that the exposure measure does not simply become a proxy measure of believability ( i.e. , NNS MD tend to VB they have seen stories they endorse before , regardless of actual exposure ) . Finally , while politically slanted FN appears to be generating the most concern in current society , it MD be of interest to VB if these results RB generalise to more general FN ( particularly those linked to CT beliefs ) . In conclusion , the community is justifiably concerned about the rise of FN and particularly JJ FN , since — at the very least — NNS who consume and VBP FN are at heightened NN of holding inaccurate beliefs about the NN ( Allcott & Gentzkow , 2017 ) . This preliminary investigation expands our understanding of JJ FN by demonstrating that CT belief is a useful starting point in identifying some of the underlying individual difference variables involved in conspiratorial and non‐conspiratorial FN belief . Future experimental and mechanism ‐based studies can further this research into this important aspect of modern society .

text: NNP , DC - Counterprotesters outnumbered members of the far - JJ Proud Boys group and their supporters at a Saturday rally that took place a few blocks from the White NNP in NNP , DC . Despite a JJ NN presence and a few minor scuffles between the opposing camps , no major outbreaks of violence took place . Held in the NNP NNPS capital 's Freedom Plaza , the " Demand Free Speech " rally organised by the Proud Boys brought RB 200 NNS together to denounce what they perceive as anti-conservative bias on the part of major JJ NN NNS . The Proud Boys are a self - described pro-Western , chauvinist " fraternity " who has been classified by the Southern Poverty Law Center as a hate group . Separated from the far - JJ rally by heavy metal barricades and NNS , hundreds of counterprotesters - largely DC residents , in contrast with their far - JJ counterparts - held a rally of their own in the adjacent Pershing Park . " I'm a native Washingtonian , and what we 're not VBG to do is allow the alt - JJ or the Proud Boys or the JJ wing to come to our city and amplify hate , bigotry and racism , " VBD NeeNee Taylor , the direct NN captain for Black Lives Matter DC . " White supremacy is not VBG to be allowed here in DC . Defending free speech is not killing someone in Charlottesville . " Organised by All Out DC , an activist collective , the counterprotest response to the far - JJ rally across the street highlighted the struggles of NNS with marginalised identities including immigrants , Native Americans and trans women of colour with speeches , chants and performances by local artists . " The NNS holding the free speech rally were kicked off JJ NN for bigotry , " VBD counterprotester and All Out DC member Laura Crain . " They are weaponising the concept of free speech and we oppose the hateful , bigoted rhetoric they espouse . " " This is how you shut down Nazis , " VBD counterprotester and DC resident Rachel Gregory . " They do n't VB away when you ignore them . As a white person , I can pass anywhere . That 's why I VBP to use that privilege , " she VBD . On the other side of the barricades , rally attendees listened to speeches from far - JJ NN personalities , who talked about how they have been affected by JJ NN bans and outlined strategies for fighting the left in the US . Although speakers at the Demand Free Speech rally frequently railed against the " violence " they feared from leftist protesters , the rhetoric they employed often referred to VBG violence and the NN to remain aggressive in the face of left - wing activists . " The left must be made to fear you …[ with ] massive brutal retaliation for the slightest of perceived insults , " disgraced writer and JJ Breitbart NNP editor Milo Yiannopoulos VBD an audience of about 200 NNS . Far - JJ JJ commentator and founder of the Proud Boys Gavin McInnes took the stage to predict the re-election of NNP Donald NNP and disparage his ideological opponents . " They can't fight , they can't argue , they can't RB VB a job , " VBD McInnes , who has since left the Proud Boys . " They can't arrest us all . Let 's fight . Let 's step into the fray . " Asked exactly what kind of speech was unfairly censored RB and off , event organiser David Sumrall of Houston , Texas , claimed that Laura Loomer - a far - JJ provocateur who was banned from NNP after tweeting Islamophobic falsehoods about US representative Ilhan Omar , a Somali refugee and CD of CD Muslim women elected to Congress - " lost her voice " for " talking down on sharia [ Islamic ] law " . Other JJ - wing personalities who had been advertised as speakers , including JJ NNP adviser Roger Stone and Pizzagate NN theorist Mike Cernovich , failed to turn up . Flamboyant rhetoric aside , only a few minor scuffles took place between rally attendees and counterprotesters , owing in JJ part to the distance created between the groups by NN barricades that made it difficult for either group to hear insults lobbed from CD side or another . The relative peace of the day 's events stood in contrast with some confrontations that took place last weekend in Portland , Oregon . Earlier in the week , the Proud Boys had been involved in a violent confrontation of their own , when they fought with members of a communist group that was burning JJ flags in front of the White NNP on July 4 . Whatever their affiliation , the CD point of agreement between JJ of the counterprotesters and far - JJ rally attendees concerned the ideological affinities of the NN . " They RB have our backs on this , " VBD Sumrall . " NNS are here to support and protect us . " Metropolitan NNP Department chief Peter Newsham VBD last week that extra officers MD be present for the duelling protests . " This is not out of the ordinary here in NNP , DC , so we 'll be ready for it , " he VBD . NN that emerged earlier in the week showing a DC NN officer fist - bumping a Proud Boy on the fourth of July after their altercation in front of the White NNP did little to dispel that impression among attendees of the far - JJ rally or the counterprotesters . " Proud Boys are just a sliver , " VBD Nelson Dolores Lopez , a member of the activist collective La Colectiva as he addressed counterprotesters in Pershing Park . Referring to the NNS guarding the barricades surrounding the far - JJ rally , he added : " The other Proud Boys are over there . "

text: The FBI has identified prominent NN NNS , including the sprawling rightwing hoax VBN as QAnon , as motivators for “ domestic extremists ” to carry out violence in the US .
